title: Join the Prompt API origin trial
description: Participate in the Prompt API origin trial to test multimodal inputs for Gemini Nano on your websites and web applications.

title: CSS conditionals with the new if() function
description: Learn about the new CSS if function, which enables a cleaner developer interface for dynamic styles like style queries and media queries.

title: Easy way to upload, transform and deliver files and images (Sponsored)
description: Managing media is a really difficult task if you try to do all of it yourself, especially if the media comes from other sources. The file can be submitted in any state and size, but what if you need something really specific? You can code it all yourself or you can use an awesome service […] The post Easy way to upload, transform and deliver files and images (Sponsored) appeared first on David Walsh Blog.
author: David Walsh

title: How to Download a YouTube Video or Channel
description: The ability to download media on the internet almost feels like a lost art. When I was in my teens, piracy of mp3s, movies, and just about everything else via torrents and apps like Kazaa, LimeWire, Napster, etc. was in full swing. These days sites use blob URLs and other means to prevent downloads. Luckily […] The post How to Download a YouTube Video or Channel appeared first on David Walsh Blog.
author: David Walsh

title: A First Look at the Interest Invoker API (for Hover-Triggered Popovers)
description: Chrome 139 is experimenting with Open UI’s proposed Interest Invoker API, which would be used to create tooltips, hover menus, hover cards, quick actions, and other types of UIs for showing more information with hover interactions. A First Look at the Interest Invoker API (for Hover-Triggered Popovers) originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
author: Daniel Schwarz

title: A Primer on Focus Trapping
description: Focus trapping is about managing focus within an element, such that focus always stays within it. The whole process sounds simple in theory, but it can quite difficult to build in practice, mostly because of the numerous parts to you got to manage. A Primer on Focus Trapping originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
author: Zell Liew
